description: a(n) is the least prime not a primitive root of n-th prime.
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(8) = 5 because 19 is the 8th prime, primes 2 and 3 are primitive roots of 19, but 5 is not.
maple: with(numtheory); for n from 1 to 100 do i := 1; while (i < n) and (primroot(ithprime(i) - 1, ithprime(n)) = ithprime(i)) do i := i+1; od; print( ithprime(i)); od:
author: _Marc LeBrun_, Feb 23 2001
extensions: Corrected by _Jud McCranie_, Mar 14 2001. Checked by _N. J. A. Sloane_ Sep 03 2002.
